summary: The Firearm Destruction Licensure Act of 2025 amends federal law to require individuals or businesses engaging in the destruction of firearms to obtain a license from the Attorney General. It defines "firearm destroyer" and "covered method of firearm destruction." The bill mandates reporting requirements for licensed dealers who destroy firearms, including those received from government entities, and authorizes grants for the destruction of firearms using approved methods. It also specifies penalties for non-compliance and directs the Attorney General to issue regulations regarding acceptable destruction methods and record-keeping.
